cheatsheet.title: Generating an EMF Model from Rose

intro.description: This cheat sheet is a step-by-step description of how to generate an EMF model and editor from a Rose class diagram.

item.title: Set up the environment
item.description: Your environment must be set up before you can perform the steps in this cheat sheet.

subitem.label: Create an "EMF Cheatsheet Data" project in your workspace with the example "library.mdl" file.
Delete or rename the following projects if they exist in your workspace: "library.rose", "library.rose.edit", "library.rose.editor".

item.title: Import the model from Rose
item.description: First, you must create a new "library.rose" EMF project in your workspace, importing the Rose model to create the EMF model.

subitem.label: Select "File > New > Project...". Expand "Eclipse Modeling Framework" and select "EMF Project". Then, click "Next".
Enter "library.rose" as the project name, then click "Next".
Click "Browse Workspace...", and expand "EMF Cheatsheet Data" to select "library.mdl". Then click "Next".

item.title: Generate the code
item.description: Generate the code to implement the model and an editor for it. The generator is automatically opened on completion of the wizard in the previous step.

subitem.label: In the generator, right click on "Library" and select "Generate ${this} Code".
If automatic building has been disabled, select "Project > Build All" to compile the generated code.

item.title: Run the generated editor
item.description: Now, you are set to run the generated editor and create a new library instance.
item.onCompletion: Congratulations! You have succesfully created an EMF model from a Rose class diagram, generated the code, and created an instance of the model.

subitem.label: Select the "library.rose" project in the package explorer and invoke the "Run > Run As > Eclipse Application" menu item. This starts a runtime instance of Eclipse with the newly generated plug-ins available.
In the runtime instance, create a new general project called "librarytest".
Expand "Example EMF Model Creation Wizards" and select "Library Model". Then, click "Next".
Enter "My.library" as the file name, then click "Next".
Select "Library"; as the model object, then click "Finish".
The generated library editor is opened. Expand "platform:/resource/librarytest/My.library". Right click "Library" and select "New Child > Writer" to create a writer object in the library.
Create additional writers and books in the library, and edit the objects' properties in the properties view.
Select "File > Save" to save the instance.
